result.execSummary:
The defendant Jonte Jamil Watts was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of THC, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(e).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

Marquette County DNA Proof of Submission

Defendant Jonte Jamil Watts in court with attorney Brian William Severson.  Chad A. Hendee appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Atty Hendee makes sentencing recommendations and does not have any objection to expunge with conditions.
Atty Severson makes sentencing arguments.

BY THE COURT:  Pay fine of $75.00 + costs = $347.50 + drug abuse surcharge $70.88 = $418.38
  Submit DNA sample and pay surcharge of $200.00
Cash bond to be applied
 If after 6 months the defendant has paid the fine and costs in full and has had no criminal violations, the defendant may petition the court for Expungement 973.015.

Defendant agrees to the $15.00 payment plan fee.
Payment Plan:  $50.00/month commencing on December 1, 2018
Sentencing hearing on October 18, 2018 at 03:00 pm.

Defendant Jonte Jamil Watts in court with attorney Brian William Severson.  Chad A. Hendee appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Atty Hendee states that this is a motion to terminate the DPA based on the defendant did not do the AODA or follow-up treatment.  Atty Severson states that the defendant has an appointment September 17th and states why.  Atty Severson objects to the termination of the DPA.  
Atty Hendee makes arguments and asks for the termination.

Atty Severson asks the court to deny the request to terminate the DPA and makes arguments.
BY THE COURT:  Motion is granted; court will terminate the DPA and find the defendant guilty, enter the judgment of conviction as of today's date.
Court will set for sentencing  Sentencing hearing scheduled for October 18, 2018 at 03:00 pm.
Motion hearing on September 6, 2018 at 11:30 am.
Motion hearing on August 1, 2018 at 11:15 am.

Atty Severson updates the Court as to the status of this matter.  Requests further hearing date to see if there can be a potential extension of the agreement.  BY THE COURT:  Court will reset 1 time.  Motion hearing scheduled for August 1, 2018 at 11:15 am.

Defendant Jonte Jamil Watts in court.  Chad A. Hendee appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Atty Hendee states that this is a motion to terminate the DPA.  Court questions the defendant.  Defendant has been provided a copy of the termination paperwork.     Court advises defendant of right to an attorney.  Defendant wants to get counsel.

BY THE COURT:  Court will reset motion to give defendant time to get an Attorney.
bond continued  Motion hearing scheduled for May 17, 2018 at 09:30 am.
posted online by Nika Dorsey
Motion hearing on April 25, 2018 at 11:45 am.

Defendant Jonte Jamil Watts appeared by video means. Prosecuting Atty Chad A. Hendee appeared for State of Wisconsin.
Atty Hendee states that the defendant failed to appear on June 8th, 2017 for a motion hearing.

BY THE COURT:  Warrant satisfied

Court questions the defendant.  Defendant gave a home address and a school address; defendant states that he didn't get any mail.  Court confirms the defendant's address.  

Atty Hendee sent a the motion to terminate to the Washington DC address.  Atty Hendee requests a $250 cash bond with conditions.

  BY THE COURT:  Court sets a $250 Cash bond with conditions:
  Motion hearing scheduled for April 25, 2018 at 11:45 am.

  Atty Hendee requests warrant based on defendant's failure to appear.  

BY THE COURT:  Warrant will issue.
UNDELIVERABLE Notice & Affidavit for Motion to Terminate
Motion hearing on June 8, 2017 at 11:30 am.
to Terminate Deferred Prosecution Agreement
in Support of Motion to Terminate Deferred Prosecution Agreement
for Deferred Prosecution Agreement s/BNB/1-18-17
Upon the defendant's plea and prior to adjudication, defendant will enter into a Deferred Prosecution Agreement for a period of: 12 months

Defendant Jonte Jamil Watts in court with attorney Brian William Severson.  Chad A. Hendee appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
  Atty Hendee states plea agreement.    Upon the defendant's plea and prior to adjudication, defendant will enter into a Deferred Prosecution Agreement for a period of:  12 months with conditions.  Atty Severson agrees.  Court questions the defendant.  Defendant agrees and enters a No Contest plea.
  Court questions defendant regarding plea. Advises of Constitutional Rights and elements of the charge.  Court finds plea made knowingly, voluntarily & Intelligently.  Court relies on the criminal complaint for a factual basis.  

Atty Severson asks the court to follow the joint recommendation.

BY THE COURT:  Court finds a sufficient factual basis to support the charges.  Court accepts defendant's plea; approves and signs the 12 month DPA with conditions.
Return date on January 18, 2017 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Jonte Jamil Watts in court with attorney Brian William Severson.  Chad A. Hendee appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Atty Hendee states that there has been discussion on possible settlement but the parties are requesting one reset.  Atty Severson agrees and asks for a reset to have time to go over the offer.

BY THE COURT:  Reset
bond continued.  Return date scheduled for January 18, 2017 at 01:30 pm.
Return date on December 7, 2016 at 01:30 pm.

with conditions:

Defendant Jonte Jamil Watts in court with attorney Mark Jay Gumz.  Chad A. Hendee appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Atty Gumz states that he will be appointing out an Attorney for Mr. Watts due to conflict.    Defendant received a copy of the criminal complaint & waives it's reading.    Attorney request the Court enter a Not Guilty plea on behalf of the defendant.

  BY THE COURT:  Court enters a Not Guilty plea on behalf of the defendant.
Court finds probable cause to support the charges.

  Atty Hendee has no objection to a signature bond with conditions.
  BY THE COURT:  Court sets a $500 Signature bond with conditions:
